snippet: Pakistani military’s continuing offensive against Islamist militants in the North Waziristan tribal region has forced an exodus of at least 1.5 million residents.
abstract: Some 250,000 Pakistanis from country's North Waziristan region have surged into Afghanistan, in reversal of trend of last three decades of war, when Afghans fled across border into Pakistan; Pakistani refugees are fleeing war between Pakistani military and Islamist militants, and seeking shelter in Pashtun tribal communities with relatives and sympathetic families; poorest of those, some 3,000 familiers, are situated in ragged and rough Gulan Camp.

byline.original: By CARLOTTA GALL and FAROOQ JAN MANGAL
byline.contributor: Haris Kakar contributed reporting from Khost Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Pakistani military’s continuing offensive against Islamist militants in the North Waziristan tribal region has forced an exodus of at least 1.5 million residents.

headline.main: In Shift, Pakistanis Fleeing War Flow Into Beleaguered Afghanistan
